doc:
Eileen Brennan https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eileen_Brennan 0 Verla Eileen Regina Brennan (née Brennen; September 3, 1932 – July 28, 2013) was an American film, stage, and television actress. She made her film debut in the satire Divorce American Style (1967), followed by a supporting role in Peter Bogdanovich's The Last Picture Show (1971), which earned her a BAFTA award nomination for Best Supporting Actress. She gained further critical acclaim for her role as Doreen Lewis in Private Benjamin, for which she received an Oscar nomination for Best Supporting Actress. She reprised the role for the TV adaptation, winning both a Golden Globe and Emmy for her performance. Brennan also starred in the mystery comedy Clue (1985), and had a minor role in the horror film Jeepers Creepers (2001). Brennan also worked prolifically in television, receiving Emmy nominations for her guest-starring roles on Newhart, Thirtysomething, Taxi and Will Grace. Verla_Eileen_Regina_Brennan ( née_Brennen ; September_3_,_1932 – July_28_,_2013 ) was an_American_film , stage , and television_actress . She made her_film_debut in the_satire_Divorce_American_Style_(_1967_) , followed by a_supporting_role in Peter_Bogdanovich 's_The_Last_Picture_Show ( 1971_) , which earned her a_BAFTA_award_nomination for Best_Supporting_Actress . She gained further_critical_acclaim for her_role as Doreen_Lewis in Private_Benjamin , for which she received an_Oscar_nomination for Best_Supporting_Actress . She reprised the_role for the_TV_adaptation , winning_both a_Golden_Globe and Emmy for her_performance . Brennan also starred in the_mystery_comedy_Clue_(_1985_) , and had a_minor_role in the_horror_film_Jeepers_Creepers_(_2001_) . Brennan also worked prolifically in television , receiving Emmy_nominations for her_guest-starring_roles on Newhart , Thirtysomething , Taxi_and_Will_ .
